model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I went to another martial arts class and had a blast.

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Speaker A is a college student who loves teaching and learning. They are regretting eating ice cream due to being lactose intolerant. Speaker A also teaches jiu-jitsu and is planning to take summer courses soon. They are taking a class on the history of martial arts and want to get an athletic training degree.

Relationship Description:
Speaker A and Speaker B have a friendly relationship, with Speaker A mentioning events and activities that may interest Speaker B. Speaker B, a software tech from England, is busy with work and misses dogs. They both share a love for martial arts and have discussed running a half marathon together.

Event Description:
Events shared between Speaker A and Speaker B include planning a trip to England, considering adopting a dog, discussing favorite restaurants in London, and signing up for online classes. Speaker A mentioned a half marathon coming up and Speaker B is considering running it despite their busy work schedule. Speaker B plans to travel back to England to visit family, friends, and dogs.
